articles.description: Added: Basic theme customization: Demo | Source | Docs.
articles.title: v1.4.0

articles.description:
Added: Link from the title of a subscription to its website.
Added: Store feedUrl and siteUrl for each source in cache.
Added: Semantic element (<time>) for timestamp on the UI.
Added: Semantic API for theming the default template. Demo | Source | Docs
Changed: Moved feed metadata from article level to feed level in cache.
Fixed: Any html-like text was stripped from title. Fixed with encoded text.
Removed: href for each source in cache. The value was never used so it's not a breaking change.
articles.title: v1.6.0

articles.description:
Added: Atom feed generator
Added: Customizable site title
Added: Copy all files from static directory to the root of the site.
Changed: Favicon, css, and js assets now existing at site root level.
Chore: Excluded testing files from repo.
articles.title: v1.5.0

articles.description:
Fixed: Avoid crwalers.
Fixed: Error logging from XML parser.
Fixed: Typo in docs.
Thank you: @dym-sh, @tabokie, @cheese1
articles.title: v1.3.1

articles.description:
Added: Customize cache lifespan with cacheMaxDays property in osmosfeed.yaml.
Added: Documentation for osmosfeed.yaml.
Fixed: More intuitive logging during build.
Chore: Refactored parameter passing for enrich step.
articles.title: v1.3.0

articles.description: Changed: favicon update.
articles.title: v1.2.3

articles.description: Added: Display CLI version in footer.
articles.title: v1.2.1

articles.description: Fixed: The output website didn't have favicon.
articles.title: v1.1.6

articles.description: Fixed: Item description didn't use the description property from feed item.
articles.title: v1.1.1

articles.description:
Added: MIT license
Added: cache.json is stamped with the version of the builder. This allows future builder with breaking change to ignore incompatible cache.
Added: Feed source retry on fetch error (3 times total, 15 seconds timeout).
Added: Item enrichment retry on fetch error (3 times total, 15 seconds timeout).
Added: Console log for cache restore and update behavior.
Added: npx command: npx osmosfeed
Changed: Improved console log that breaks down rendered item count into "new" and "cached".
Fixed: Item‚Ä¶
articles.title: v1.1.0

articles.author: Demitrius Nelon
articles.description:
We have been hard at work building new experimental features for the Windows Package Manager. We have just released the Windows Package Manager v0.3 Preview. I would like to share the first major feature to exit experimental status. I also have the privilege of announcing support for Group Policy.
The post Windows Package Manager v0.3 Preview appeared first on Windows Command Line.
articles.title: Windows Package Manager v0.3 Preview

articles.author: Craig Loewen
articles.description:
A year ago at BUILD 2020 we introduced our goal to bring Linux GUI applications to the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) to run Linux GUI applications. We are proud to announce the first preview of this highly anticipated and open source feature!
The post The Initial Preview of GUI app support is now available for the Windows Subsystem for Linux appeared first on Windows Command Line.
articles.title: The Initial Preview of GUI app support is now available for the Windows Subsystem for Linux

articles.author: Steve Pronovost
articles.description:
If you landed on this blog, you‚Äôve probably seen our announcement for GUI applications support in the Windows Subsystem for Linux being available to Windows Insiders and looking for more details on how WSLg was built. If so, you‚Äôve come to the right place!
The post WSLg Architecture appeared first on Windows Command Line.
articles.title: WSLg Architecture

articles.author: Craig Loewen
articles.description:
Note: This blog post is co-authored by the awesome WSL dev Pierre Boulay. Thanks Pierre! üòä

articles.title: Servicing the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) 2 Linux kernel

articles.author: Kayla Cinnamon
articles.description:
Welcome back to another release of Windows Terminal! This release updates Windows Terminal Preview to version 1.8 and moves Windows Terminal to version 1.7. Both builds can be installed from the Microsoft Store as well as the GitHub releases page. Let’s jump into what’s new!
The post Windows Terminal Preview 1.8 Release appeared first on Windows Command Line.
articles.title: Windows Terminal Preview 1.8 Release

articles.description:
The invention of the internal combustion engine in the 19th century has revolutionized transportation over land, water, and air.
